intro: Gomotriche, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-like structure. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating. Gomotriche is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested. It plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for certain insects and animals.
